title: How to Cook Ukrainian Green Borsch with Sorrel

steps.headline: Peel and wash all of the vegetables.
Slice the beetroot lengthwise, then slice again to get long strips.
steps.description: Preheat vegetable oil in the frying pan, add the beetroot strips and fry on medium, until softened.

steps.headline: Bring the chicken stock to the boil.
steps.description: Add salt to your taste, about 1 teaspoon. Place the fried beetroot into the simmering stock, taking care to leave the oil in the pan. Cook the beets in the stock under a lid.

steps.headline: Chop the cooking onion.
steps.description: Fry in the pan on slow heat, until golden and crispy.

steps.headline: Cut the potatoes into 1 inch (2.5 cm) cubes.
steps.description: Add to the stock with the beets, bring to the boil, then reduce heat and simmer under a lid.

steps.headline: Chop the salad onions.
steps.description: Add to the stock, simmer under lid. Be sure to add these quickly after adding the potatoes.

steps.headline: Chop the dill.
steps.description: Add to the stock, continue simmering under a lid.

steps.headline: Check with the knife to see if the potato in the stock is cooked.
steps.description: By now, it should be cooked.

steps.headline: Chop the sorrel leaves roughly.
steps.description: Add to the stock, together with the fried onion. Bring to the boil, turn off the heat and cover the green borsch with the lid. Let the soup stand 30 minutes before serving.

steps.headline: Serve with a hard boiled egg for each portion, roughly chopped and a tablespoon of soured cream.

text: Peel and wash all of the vegetables.  Slice the beetroot lengthwise, then slice again to get long strips. Preheat vegetable oil in the frying pan, add the beetroot strips and fry on medium, until softened. Bring the chicken stock to the boil. Add salt to your taste, about 1 teaspoon. Place the fried beetroot into the simmering stock, taking care to leave the oil in the pan. Cook the beets in the stock under a lid. Chop the cooking onion. Fry in the pan on slow heat, until golden and crispy. Cut the potatoes into 1 inch (2.5 cm) cubes. Add to the stock with the beets, bring to the boil, then reduce heat and simmer under a lid. Chop the salad onions. Add to the stock, simmer under lid. Be sure to add these quickly after adding the potatoes. Chop the dill. Add to the stock, continue simmering under a lid. Check with the knife to see if the potato in the stock is cooked. By now, it should be cooked. Chop the sorrel leaves roughly. Add to the stock, together with the fried onion. Bring to the boil, turn off the heat and cover the green borsch with the lid. Let the soup stand 30 minutes before serving. Serve with a hard boiled egg for each portion, roughly chopped and a tablespoon of soured cream. Enjoy!
